tripreview.Title: "Unwelcoming"
tripreview.sentence: Gruff personnel who appeared only to be interested in collecting fees.
We asked what we would see if we were to enter the museum, and were only told (repeatedly) that tickes cost 50 rupees.

tripreview.Title: "History of the city"
tripreview.sentence: The palace and it's contents tell us the history of Fort Kochi and the Royal families ruled over there.
It's very nice.

tripreview.Title: "Takes you to the past glory of Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: I was able to visit the following places in Mattancherry: Dutch Palace - This is more of a museum and stores a lot from that era.
This is a must watch for anyone who loves history.
Jewish Synagogue - I have missed this many a times on my previous visits.
But this time the synagogue was open.
The synagogue was truly spectacular.
The Belgian glass chandeliers adorning the prayer hall having prussian blue tiles on the floor is a sight to be seen.
Synagogue should be the reason to visit this part of mattancherry.
There is also a pictorial representation of the history of jews in india.
Jewish Street - Just 5 mins walk thats all it is.
But still the shops and the items are worth a see.
I enjoyed it.
Jain Temple - I felt the one at Alappuzha was better than this in terms of its architecture.

tripreview.Title: "Good to see the old town"
tripreview.sentence: Good place.

tripreview.Title: "Not my favourite place in India"
tripreview.sentence: My wife and I had had just the most fantasic week in India, this was where we began our last day.
All a bit touristy, lots of hawkers harassing you.
We walked inside and towards Fort Kochi, that was more interesting and though there is nothing to see but people and streets, it managed to bump it up from 2 stars to 3.

tripreview.Title: "Spice Market"
tripreview.sentence: Spices are not so cheap.
Found them priced similarly to Bangalore.
Dutch Palace n Jew Synagogue are places to visit in this area.

tripreview.Title: "REMNISCENCES OF AN OLD COMMERCIAL CENTRE"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry as you see now was a different place, a few years ago.
It was a place where there were so many godowns / trading centers all along the Bazar Road, Jew Town and nearby places where spices of all sorts were dried, cleaned, graded and traded.
These places, in those days were bustled with workers, traders and other allied activities.
Majority of spice dealers were Gujarathis.
When one walk by these streets, the air was filled with the pleasant smell of Pepper, Ginger, Turmeric, Cardamom, etc.
But gone are those days now.
Almost all godowns are closed and Gujarathis who were in Spices business have left the place.
Now what you can see on road sides in Mattancherry are antique shops.
The travelers who come to Mattancherry / Fort Kochi get tempted to buy mementos from those shops.
But, most of the items sold there are not antique; but, fakes.
The buyer beware.
Mattancherry Palace @ Dutch Palace built in 1550 is a center of attraction.
The murals on the walls and certain other exhibits used by Cochin Rajas are worth seeing.
Jews Synagogue nearby which was built around 1500 years ago is yet another attraction.
One has two options to proceed from Mattancherry; to the main land Ernakulam or the nearby Fort Kochi.
If one wants to proceed to Ernakulam, the easiest and attractive way is to proceed by ferry.
Govt operated boat services are very cheap and a ride to Ernakulam by back water shall linger in your memories.
Whereas, if your destination is Fort Kochi I would suggest one to walk by Palace Road just opposite to Mattancherry Palace.
Please remember, Fort Kochi is a must see; so also Ernakulam.

tripreview.Title: "Antiques and spices, rest of it caught in a time warp"
tripreview.sentence: The area has been very effectively developed as a shoppers paradise for antiques, clothes and spices- not all of it locally produced, but for a foreign traveller, certainly "from India".
The museum is worth a visit just to get a historic perspective of Kerala.
The synagogue is a fairly nondescript building, but obviously carries a lot of history- only 4 Jew families live in the area now.
A few cafes ( Ginger has good sit out facing the wellington island) offer food for the hungry, but nothing to write home about.

tripreview.Title: "Very interesting"
tripreview.sentence: Very interesting visit, If one is interested in the history of Kochi then this is the place to visit.
Learnt a lot about the royal family of Kochi and about the customs and habits of this old city.

tripreview.Title: "Boating, the not-so-famous attraction of Mattancherry"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is famous for its Dutch Palace, Jew Street, Synagogue and the shops that sell all things unique about Kerala.
A lot has been written about those.
I am going to write about the least popular attraction of Mettancherry: the boat jetty.
The jetty is bang opposite the main entrance of the Dutch Palace.
A small sign board quietly announces its existence.
You will not find many tourists around this area.
The jetty is mainly used for local boat traffic.
Public boats - similar to public buses - make a quick stop at this tiny harbour before proceeding to their long list of destinations.
During afternoon you get to see some double-decker motorized launches picking up tourists for boating.
You pay some nominal amount for a ride lasting about an hour and half.
As you float around in the area between Wellingdon Island and mainland, you get to see Cochin Port and its huge ships from a distance.
This is the only way you can view the port, which is otherwise a restricted area.
Sharing some photos that I clicked.

tripreview.Title: "Nice amalgamation of Malabar, Jew and Dutch cultures"
tripreview.sentence: Jew Town is a must visit place.
Sad that Synagogue does not allow photography.
Dutch Palace can be given a miss, unless you need to know about the history of the place.
Roads are mostly narrow and at times becomes difficult to navigate, even on foot, due to traffic.

tripreview.Title: "lose yourself in the antique stores"
tripreview.sentence: there are many antique stores in Mattancherry area, this area is about 3 kms from Fort Kochi area.
but one must spend a good 3-4 hours walking around this place.
Check out the antique stores and the lovely cafes attached to these.

tripreview.Title: "Good place for shopping"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is a very good place for shopping of antiques and spices.
The Jew Town have a vast collection of rare antiques.
But it is also very expensive.

tripreview.Title: "Jews museum and Jews market is really excellent. enjoy boating too"
tripreview.sentence: well maintained Museum with proper discipline, jewish market, temple and police Museum in an area of 200 mtrs.
synagogue is also worth visiting.
market is very well organized.

tripreview.Title: "A town with history and tradition"
tripreview.sentence: The synagogue and the art emporiums are worth visiting.
The smell of spices in the streets while you walk will really attract evryone.

tripreview.Title: "Spice world"
tripreview.sentence: Wander along the harbour side road and check out all the sights and incredible smells of the wholesale warehouses and shops that line the road.

tripreview.Title: "good old place"
tripreview.sentence: The palace turned small museum is worth seeing.

tripreview.Title: "old world charm"
tripreview.sentence: The Old Jewish quarter, lovely shops no hassle, great antique shops and cafes/ restaurants.
Spice shops in this part of town do not reduce their prices too much with haggling making it exceptionally bad value for money.
over all a Good place to walk around.

tripreview.Title: "History at it's best!"
tripreview.sentence: The Mattancherry Palace is full of information.
The wall paintings are awesome and well preserved.
The artifacts, the images, the costumes, materials, weapons used in those time etc.
Overall a good experience.

tripreview.Title: "nothing much to see..."
tripreview.sentence: good shopping place for souvenirs.
and interesting colorfull ornaments.

tripreview.Title: "Good if you like history"
tripreview.sentence: Dutch palace was ok.
Museum was very small.
Jewish synagogue was good.
Go if you like history.
Lot of art ware shops.
Shop with caution .
Most of the shops are not genuine.

tripreview.Title: "Worth the walk"
tripreview.sentence: Took a walk down some off the tourist trail streets to visit Jewish quarter and cafe .

tripreview.Title: "Historically significant place"
tripreview.sentence: This is a very old palace.
This place used to be the residence of the royal family in Kerala.
It is very old building and has been converted to a museum.
It is great for people interested in history.
Teenagers and youngsters may find this place very boring.
Also the place is very crowded.

tripreview.Title: "Gives a portugal architecture view"
tripreview.sentence: Royal displays of RAJA VERMA like palanquins and throne, costumes , mural paintings makes it interesting to visit the place.
Decorated Ceilings reflected the style of the then Dynasty with highlights on paintaings of Hindu legend times like Ramayana and Mahabharata.
Very educative and informative.

tripreview.Title: "Nice old buildings"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry has a very special atmosphere with all the trading companies selling rice, flour and spices.
Take a bike and follow the streets, it's the best way to experience how people work and live there.
Houses are quite old, but beautiful and special.
If you find some time, be sure to visit springR-cafe on Bazaar Street.

tripreview.Title: "GOOD WHIRF"
tripreview.sentence: Good too see big ships coming and berthing.
Actually its a whirf.
Also their is a navy base.
Saw different coast guard vessels for the first time.

tripreview.Title: "very nice palace good histoy behind it"
tripreview.sentence: Very nice palace with marvellous frescos Must visit in fort kochi area.

tripreview.Title: "Stunning wall paintings"
tripreview.sentence: These were fabulous and a real treat, pity no guide book as you cannot take photos in the Museum.
It was helpful that we had a local guide to explain.

tripreview.Title: "Colourful and bustling part of town"
tripreview.sentence: Definitely worth hiring a driver to take you to Mattancherry.
It's fascinating.
Ask to visit the the Jewish synagogue and the Dutch Palace.
There are also lots of colourful shops selling clothes, souvenirs and spices.

tripreview.Title: "Good but for the drivers"
tripreview.sentence: Good place to walk around with interesting shops and some sights nearby (Synagogue and Dutch Museum).
Good for shopping from clothes to spices The big negative is all the TukTuk drivers who will try and get you into shops.
Even if you agree a price up front, they still try and reduce it to bring you somewhere to the point of frustration.
Also quite congested roads en route from Fort Cochin.

tripreview.Title: "annoying ricksaw drivers"
tripreview.sentence: The place itself would be nice.
The shop owners and ricksaw drivers are really annoying and spoil all the nice atmosphere.
While walking around it is a constant hassle.
Be careful in the shops - a lot of products are of very low quality and they are extremely expensive.

tripreview.Title: "Palace"
tripreview.sentence: Its very nice to visit there.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting sight to visit"
tripreview.sentence: Good place to visit and wander around when in Kochi.
Gets busy so go first thing or later in the day to avoid the queues.
Entrance fee is 5 rupees and they don't like giving change so try have correct money.

tripreview.Title: "Nice. Very Nice."
tripreview.sentence: I like the waters, as does anyone from the land locked kingdom of Delhi.
Mattancherry offers a window into the laid back, simplistic life of fishermen, and men of means and resources.
Though a little crowded, the place is not like many others that dons a mask for tourists - it is raw, and what you see is what you get.

tripreview.Title: "GOOD"
tripreview.sentence: We stayed at the hotel for a day when on a business trip.
The property is located on Marine Drive overlooking the sea.
Most of the rooms have a sea view i guess since we had three rooms in different wings and all of them overlooked the sea.
The rooms are slightly smaller by Gateway standards.
Other facilities in the room are in line with other Gateway properties.
Staff including restaurant staff is as usual extra courteous, cheerful and helpful.
The hotel surprisingly doesn't have buffet dinner.
We had dinner at the all day restaurant late at night which was good.
The buffet breakfast spread was also very good.
Overall the service was fairly good.
I used the swimming pool which was decent except that I felt that the chlorine content was slightly higher since my eyes were burning.
Overall a good business hotel and fairly priced.

tripreview.Title: "Historical Kochin"
tripreview.sentence: Vasco Da Gamar was buried there.
Kochin was the port for trading of spices.
We can still buy freah spices.

tripreview.Title: "view is superb"
tripreview.sentence: once u r here no site and way to visit by boat ride can be better than this .
Its simply superb for shopping antiques and spices.

tripreview.Title: "Walk down Jewish history in Kerala"
tripreview.sentence: The place have a famous Jew church and a lot of antique shops.
It feels great when you take a walk through the Jew Street here.
Also the boat ride can help you freshen up.

tripreview.Title: "old world charm"
tripreview.sentence: the old jewish synagogue and the streets are neatly maintained.
it took just a few minutes inside the synagogue.

tripreview.Title: "Old Palace"
tripreview.sentence: Old palace was built in the year of 1940's.
excellent constructions.
still the palace is very famous and we have seen lot of tourist are coming to visit the great Old Palace.

tripreview.Title: "We had visited the old palace."
tripreview.sentence: We had visited mattanchery palace, antic shop, both road side was very crowd with small shops.
we had a great time to purchase spices.

tripreview.Title: "The Former dutch Palace"
tripreview.sentence: You can get to Fort Kochi by bas or boat.
By boat you will pass the backwaters to fort Kochi at only less than 1usd.
it is an old ferry and a wothwhile sxperience.
it take less than 30 min at arrive at fort kochi.

at the pier there will many tricycles waiting to take you around at a cost (do bargain) One bad thiing is they will stop along the way for you to visit many shops which i beleive they get a comission.
Manttercher is located on palace road.
The palace was constructed by the Portuguese and presented to the then King of Kochi.
It was later renovated and now it has a bit of Hindu texture.
In fact, it has become one of the best testimony of the Hindu Temple Art.
The Palace is a two stored building with a courtyard.
The entrance to the palace is of arch shaped.
The doors and windows are all rounded.
You will also find a Hindu temple built by the side of the palace.
this place is serene and worth the visit.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely."
tripreview.sentence: We are currently staying here in a homestay, and I have to admit, I like it.
I think it has a good range of shops, offering choice for just about everyone, and there are some good restaurants in the area.
The shop owners don't hassle you too much as I have found in other parts of Kochi.
Plus, if you're lost (which has happened to me), the people are more than happy to help you out!
I also feel safe here, which is a major factor when choosing somewhere to be.

tripreview.Title: "Fort Visit"
tripreview.sentence: Nice very historic with good antiques of palanquin and dragon boat.
The paintings were well preserved.
The photos were very informative providing the history of the varma dynasty.
There were ancient maps of varma empire along with anglo-dutch influence.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely, atmospheric area"
tripreview.sentence: Lovely calm area, lots going on.
A lot of variety in the shops with very little hassle from shop keepers.
The majority of the auto rickshaw drivers were helpful and did not overcharge.
The ferry service to the islands is a treat and so cheap.

tripreview.Title: "Ok to visit."
tripreview.sentence: The palace is very small one, its converted to a museum.
You can find history of kerala in the museum, but dont expect it to be a marvelous arctecturaial beauty as other palaces around india.

tripreview.Title: "can be visited"
tripreview.sentence: Good place to visit.
But see the timings on the net at what time it is open.
Matancherry palace and Dutch palace are the same.

tripreview.Title: "always loved it."
tripreview.sentence: i have visited this place many times.
for me the cochin backwaters and mattancherry is the best place to visit in cochin.
the boat ride from cochin mainland is simply marvelous.
the sites at mattancherry , like the spice market, the church , the oldest Jewish synagogue and the Chinese fishing nets, all are worth seeing at least once.
this place has the sight and smell of very old days, with a lot of history behind it.
really a very nice place.

tripreview.Title: "Nice gardens, but not well kept"
tripreview.sentence: Too bad this place has not been kept as it should, since its location and cultural interest would definitely deserve more.
That said, not many more things around Kochin to see.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: Its much older than their time there and they just renovated it.
The wall paintings in the palace are stunning and the information very well presented.

tripreview.Title: "The Most Advanced Demonstrating place"
tripreview.sentence: The place where Muslims Footed in India, the place where the christianity Entered.
The place where the sikh Formed in Kerala.
Religion wise ,Regionalwis e the Best place to start a game.
I AM A TOUR GUIDE.

tripreview.Title: "Place welcomed every Migrant Comunity ..."
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry, the western part of the corporation of Cochin, was once a bustling centre of trade, particularly in spices.
Invasions from across the sea was frequent and the invaders left indelible marks on the landscape, culture, art and social history of the place.

tripreview.Title: "Old world Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: Not much have changed here for a long time, it is full of canals and surrounded by water of the Vembanadu Lake and Arabian sea, To go to Mattancherry one can approach it from Wellington Island but now we can go there directly from Ernakulam all connected to Mattancherry by bridges.

The traffic is very congested so my suggestion is to avoid road and take a boat trip to Mattancherry from Ernakulam boat jetty to Mattancherry or Fort Kochi, the cost negligible few pence in pound sterling, one would safe lot of valuable time and see spectacular views of Mattancherry from the water, by road one will only see congested roads.
In olden days this area was the hub of trade that came by punting boats.

tripreview.Title: "Worth a visit"
tripreview.sentence: This place looks dull on the outside but is lovely and interesting on the inside and it only costs about 15pence!

tripreview.Title: "Nice Trip for a Change from Fort Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: We walked 2-3km stright road from fort kochi to Mattancherry just for a change.
It's a big change i would say.
One the way there are many whole sale kind of shop, small houses, can see some real life style until we reach mattancherry.
At mattancherry we found many antic kind of shops, cloth shops to attract foreign tourist.
Some shops having unbelievable collection like huge stone curved items, wooden horse etc I personally found it's worth a visit for 1 hours and for some change.

tripreview.Title: "Spices quarter"
tripreview.sentence: Neigbouring the palace is the old quarter known for spice trading.
Nowadays only few real traders are left, it's getting more commercialised but spices are still the main commodities.
You can take a short walk and sniff the spices.

tripreview.Title: "Good if you love History."
tripreview.sentence: An old palace with very ancient collections inside.
Boards explaining the historical importance/messages are a huge hit among tourists.
Takes you back to 18'th century.

tripreview.Title: "betterment required"
tripreview.sentence: I don't know why when we take pics people hide their items around and not like other areas of kochi.
Lot of sad people too put us down.

tripreview.Title: "Bustling little lanes and shops"
tripreview.sentence: We went on a Sunday, so the streets were less crowded.
We hired bicycles and toured the place, so all in all it was a great morning spent.
A lot of shops were closed but enough were open to ensure you pick up your share of the famous Kerala spices.

tripreview.Title: "Mattancherry was the first trade hub of the present Kochi District."
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is a part of Kochi District in Kerala, India.
It is a tourist destination.
It is surrounded by the backwaters of Arabian Sea.
Mattancherry was the first trade hub of the present district.
It is about 9 km from Kochi town.
There are frequent bus and boat services to Mattancherry from Kochi town.
The boats start from Main Boat Jetty near Subash Park at Kochi .

tripreview.Title: "MATTANCHERY IN COCHIN"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is a part of Ernakulam District in Kerala, India.
It is a tourist destination.
It is surrounded by the backwaters of Arabian Sea.
Mattancherry is populated by people from various walks of life and various parts of India and Abroad.
There are people who have come and settled in Mattancherry from Goa, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat and so on.
Earlier Mattancherry was the trade link to Ernakulam.
Main Trade was on spices such as pepper and turmeric.
Tea is also traded.
Mattancherry deteriorated mainly since the porters working at various firms had some unaccounted trouble with the Merchants.
Slowly the traders moved to Ernakulam as Mattancherry proved to be costly.
Mattancherry is also home to the Paradesi Synagogue (India's oldest functioning synagogue, where the ticket-seller, Yaheh Hallegua, is the last female Paradesi Jew of child-bearing age).
Mattancherry Palace Museum hosts different weapons such as swords, spears and various other artilleries such as cannon used to protect the borders from invaders in the historic ages.
The museum also hosts various paintings and murals.
Near the museum, a private bus depot is also present.
Close to the Bus Depot there is a Boat Jetty, where we get boats to Ernakulam, Fort Cochin and Willington Island.
There is also Bazaar (Market) where we get to buy different spices and articles used interior decorations.
Mattancherry is famous for having "Jew Town" in its heart.
This is a historical part of India, where the ancient Jews started their trading.
This neighborhood is now famous for antique showrooms.
Jew Palace and the Jewish synagogue are two famous landmarks.

tripreview.Title: "Interesting area to wander through"
tripreview.sentence: This old area of Kochi is fascinating for its old colonial era buildings and narrow streets full of activity.
There are many tourist shops but they are not too annoying.

Also many antique shops - some artefacts even look genuine.
'
Also plenty of spice shops, but they are a rather expensive way of buying spices.
Also plenty of spice shops, but they are a rather expensive way of buying spices.
Mixed in with these are many of the original trading places and this is the best part of Mattancherry.

tripreview.Title: "lovely place to stay."
tripreview.sentence: Its right next to fort kochi.
We stayed in a home-stay.
Which was quite comfortable.
We hired bicycles to go around the little town and visit the different places in our itinerary.

tripreview.Title: "floating paradise"
tripreview.sentence: this small piece of land situated at a ferry ride of 10 mins from Ernakulum is a must to visit place.

tripreview.Title: "good for history buffs"
tripreview.sentence: nice place to savor in some history and do some street shopping
might be a little expensive though, this being a touristy place.

tripreview.Title: "This place houses the old Christian Syrian Churches"
tripreview.sentence: Very well-maintained churches gives a lot of joy to find such places in India.
There is nothing you would like to hate at such places,its all very soothing to your eyes.

tripreview.Title: "A walk to the olden days"
tripreview.sentence: Mattanchery is an old town and a walk through the streets will take you to olden times when the state had lot of foreigners coming in for trade purposes.

tripreview.Title: "Old and authentic"
tripreview.sentence: Enjoyed the quaint shops and did most of my shopping here.
It was clean, had ambiance and was for the most part hassle-free.

tripreview.Title: "Good place to visit, but dont expect much"
tripreview.sentence: Was a busy area with lots of activities going on.
good experience.
dutch palace was interesting.
Jew town, pushy shop attendants, need to bargain hard.
Cheaper prices of clothes were cheaper in broadway (ernakulam).

tripreview.Title: "Good place for antics and spices"
tripreview.sentence: The spice bazaar at Mattancherry is very good and value for money.
Indeed it is one of the best in Kochi.
People with liking for antics will definitely get good options.

tripreview.Title: "Go beyond the shop fronts towards the water..."
tripreview.sentence: behind the shops we discovered fishermen returning with colorful nets and colorful boats.
Also, saw laborers at work loading and unloading goods.

tripreview.Title: "Just a village area"
tripreview.sentence: Not so much to see in the area other than a few so-called palaces that don't really look like palaces from any angle.
Other than that it's just a small market area.

tripreview.Title: "Palace very good but synagogue only Ok"
tripreview.sentence: The palace was fascinating with lots of old photos and artifacts.

tripreview.Title: "You will find all sort of things here"
tripreview.sentence: i did about 20KG of shopping here lotsa stuff on bargain.

tripreview.Title: "Good for casual visit"
tripreview.sentence: It has become almost like shopping areas and be choosy while you make a purchase.
The collections are good though they are not extraordinary
